answerText: PEP carboxylase (or phosphoenolpyruvate carboxylase; do not accept "PEP")[10] PEP carboxylase is used in plants that undergo C4 carbon fixation, unlike plants that use this means to fix carbon. In this light-independent cycle, plants use RuBisCO to turn carbon dioxide into G3P.
heading: SUBMIT |2014 | Editors 4 | 1 | Science | Biology | College
subject: Science
question: Question:  [10] Name this enzyme which turns its namesake compound and bicarbonate into oxaloacetate.
